answers.answer: Assistance for newcomers includes information on managing in the new city, a support program for accommodation, meals, and integration, as well as support from various organizations. Help is also available for legal status, housing, and jobs.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: For medical services, you can go to the County Emergency Clinical Hospital Brăila or find a list of family doctors. For public transportation, information is available on how and where to buy tickets.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the sections under 'Medical services' and 'Public transport in Brăila'.

answers.answer: For children, resources are available for enrolling them in primary education, including details on required documents and information about the education system in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Information on legal matters can be found under 'Legal status', and details regarding housing are available under 'Housing Info'.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the sections under 'Legal status' and 'Housing Info'.

answers.answer: Support services include a Women's Center for reproductive health, navigating the health system, and aid for victims of domestic violence. Additionally, free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services are offered through specialist doctors and Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the sections under 'Women's Center' and 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
